result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramon A Denicola

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:12 AM; Case called for Pretrial conference. Defendant Ramon A Denicola in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.  Court confirms with the defendant that he plans to proceed without counsel.  Court inquires how the defendant wants to proceed.  Defendant advises that the DA he met with advised he ask for another court date, but the defendant would like to try to resolve the matter but is not sure how to do that.  Court will allow one more pretrial date; if matter does not resolve then the matter will be set for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.

9:08 AM Defendant Ramon A Denicola in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
